remarks: Lemma of the symetrial quadrilateral.  The diagonals of quadrilaterals with congruent opposing sides intersect at their middle point.  In Euclidean geometry, such quadrilaterals are called parallelograms, as opposing sides are parallel.  However, this is not true in the case of absolute geometry.  Lemma 7.21 of [Schwabhauser] p. 52.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 6-Aug-2019.)
